qas.question: What are small freight elevators used for things such as food, called?
What rooms are dumbwaiters frequently used in?

answers.text: They often connect kitchens to rooms on other floors

qas.question: What is a safety feature found in passenger elevators they generally do not have?
What is the height restriction on dumbwaiters?

answers.text: they can be up to 1 meter (3 ft.) tall

qas.question: What features do they have that mimic passenger elevators?

context: <a0_0>Dumbwaiters<a0_0/> are small freight elevators that are intended to carry food, books or other small freight loads rather than passengers. <a1_0>They often connect kitchens to rooms on other floors<a1_0/>. they usually do not have the same safety features found in passenger elevators, like <a2_0>various ropes for redundancy<a2_0/>. they have a lower capacity, and <a3_0>they can be up to 1 meter (3 ft.) tall<a3_0/>. there's a control panel at every stop, that mimics the ones found in passenger elevators, like <a4_0>calling, door control, floor selection<a4_0/>.
